intro: Chiloschista bleeseri, commonly known as the Bleeser's chiloschista, is a rare and unique member of the Apiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Native to specific regions in South Africa, it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and full sun exposure. The plant is noted for its delicate appearance and is often found in coastal and mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
